text: What do you think of PHP's new namespace separator?
PHP 5.3 (alpha) has had namespace support for a while using '::' as a separator.
But due to some problems with ambiguity with this separator, the PHP team has decided on '\'.
From a recent story on Slashdot:
Who else thinks '\' is one of the worst separators?
'\' is almost universally accepted as an escape character, but besides that it just looks unnatural.
